Example timetable subset

Source: R/timetable-data.R
timetable_subset.Rd

Processed timetable containing only relevant services travelling in one direction specified by the Centrix data

Usage

timetable_subset

Format

train_header

Train ID. This usually contains headcode information

dt_origin

Date and time of service origin

geo

Name of TIPLOCs that trains pass through or stop at

event

Type of timetable event, e.g., 'Arrive', 'Depart', 'Pass'

wtt

Scheduled date and time of event

t

Actual date and time of event

delay

Difference between actual time and scheduled time

allow

Total delay allowance

allow_perf

Performance allowance

allow_path

Pathing allowance

allow_eng

Engineering allowance

group

Train group, corresponds to its calling pattern

See also

wrangle_timetable() calculate_journey_specifications() match_ids()

Data frame with 792 rows and 12 columns

Examples

timetable_subset
#> # A tibble: 792 × 12
#>    train_header dt_origin           geo    event  wtt                
#>    <chr>        <dttm>              <chr>  <chr>  <dttm>             
#>  1 108H         2000-01-01 12:55:00 geo5   Arrive 2000-01-01 13:34:00
#>  2 108H         2000-01-01 12:55:00 geo5   Depart 2000-01-01 13:35:30
#>  3 108H         2000-01-01 12:55:00 geo6   Pass   2000-01-01 13:37:30
#>  4 108H         2000-01-01 12:55:00 geo110 Arrive 2000-01-01 13:39:00
#>  5 108H         2000-01-01 12:55:00 geo110 Depart 2000-01-01 13:39:30
#>  6 108H         2000-01-01 12:55:00 geo111 Arrive 2000-01-01 13:42:00
#>  7 108H         2000-01-01 12:55:00 geo111 Depart 2000-01-01 13:42:30
#>  8 108H         2000-01-01 12:55:00 geo112 Arrive 2000-01-01 13:44:30
#>  9 108H         2000-01-01 12:55:00 geo112 Depart 2000-01-01 13:45:00
#> 10 108H         2000-01-01 12:55:00 geo7   Arrive 2000-01-01 13:48:00
#> # ℹ 782 more rows
#> # ℹ 7 more variables: t <dttm>, delay <dbl>, allow <dbl>, allow_perf <dbl>,
#> #   allow_path <dbl>, allow_eng <dbl>, group <chr>
